dlgPart.npc_text:
Faelan the Thrice Blessed owed everything he had - including his life - to Lord Meru who saved him from the gallows. Born a slave, Faelan made his life a lot harder by refusing to keep his eyes down. He was always staring at people, staring with such intensity that it made even hardened Imperial Guardsmen uncomfortable. It was that staring as much as his refusal to work that earned him the beatings. When the Guardsmen had finally had enough of his resistance and came to make an example of him, witnesses say he did nothing to defend himself. He simply stared at the soldiers, and smiled that twisted smile. And, one by one, they took out their daggers and slit their own throats.
Terrifying though this display of power was, the Imperial Guards were veterans of many battles. Quickly recovering from their shock, the remaining Guards overwhelmed Faelan with their numbers, beating him unconscious. His execution would have followed swiftly if word of his deed hadn't reached the ears of Lord Meru. And so Faelan the slave became Faelan the Thrice Blessed, the Magus of House Crassus, a position of near unlimited wealth and influence.

Faelan is already awake, assuming the man ever sleeps, and his attention is on some charts. His back is exposed, and you move silently toward him.
As if sensing your presence, the magus slowly turns his head to the side. Before you can stop him, the man to your right conjures a dagger and quickly throws it at the magus, but it stops in midair as if hitting an invisible wall and drops to the floor.
Without a word, the magus turns around and stares at you. Suddenly, you feel confused and unsure of yourself. You can't even remember why you're here. You glance around and see two men, looking as lost and confused as you are. They seem familiar to you, somehow, but it seems so unimportant.
“Kill them,” says the magus, addressing nobody in particular, and you’re filled with the burning desire to protect him. His life is all that matters and you’ll gladly die for him, in fact, you’re eager to die for him.

You put a dried blood mushroom in your mouth and start chewing. Nothing happens and the desire to die for the magus grows stronger, slowly becoming an obsession. You take another ‘shroom – you don’t feel any different but the obsessive desire starts fading away, giving room to suspicion.
The magus makes a strange face and you laugh. Suddenly, the chamber explodes with color. It leaches from the objects, forming glowing orbs tracking your every move. The magus! He’s casting a spell! He lured you here to kill you, but you’re going to kill him first!
Realizing that you see right through him, the magus calls off the glamour and the glowing orbs disappear, the chamber becoming dark and filthy. The magus’ face twists into a terrifying visage, finally revealing his true self.
You blink and see that there are two men standing in front of you now. No, three! Four! There are four of him! So that’s his secret! You knew it, you fucking knew it all along!

dlgAnsw.text: Kill the magi before they steal your body and turn you into one of them!

You open your eyes. Though still blurry from the light of the room, you can see the magus, with his hand clutched against his bloody jaw. As your vision begins to clear, you begin to see the intensity in the magus' eyes... as he stares... into... your...
For a moment, your mind feels cloudy and your senses dull, but it soon fades away and your vision becomes clear, perhaps clearer than it has ever been. You can see them, all of them, a world away yet standing beside you, smiling, and happy. The ones you've loved, the ones you've known only in passing, and even the ones you've killed. They're waiting, waiting for you to be at peace, waiting for you to join them.
You are so tired, so very tired. All you have worked for, fought for, seem so far away now. You look down and see something in your hands. You grasp it tightly and you smile, for at last, you have found your peace.
